LISTEN Best ways to think of new ideas to help others get what they want is to listen to them. Make sure to always write it down. James Altucher uses restaurant server writing pads to come up with 10 new ideas each day. I use letter envelopes. He had just lost all his money and business and came up with the idea to use them as a means to write down all the ideas that he had for business. This way if he was ever in the situation again he could always refer to the pads. Just observe your surroundings constantly. I've personally grown my business by listening to my customer and filling their demands. It really isn't hard to do though it takes much persistence and a desire to launch. You can also take something and improve it. One example would be Starbucks. They took the everyday $1 cup of coffee and turned it into an empire where people on average spend $5 for a coffee. It's become a complete movement, a way of our society. Try taking something that you're already doing and know well and expand on it. Make it bigger! When that happens you have a bigger business and adding people to support your bigger idea!

Find a problem that frustrates you and think of 10 ideas on how to solve it. For example, you notice how your school’s parking garage never has any parking. You waste time going up and down the garage only to leave the parking structure to find a space elsewhere. How can you fix that? With technology that can let people know how many spaces are left on that floor?With an iPhone app that allows you to see the map view of the garage in real time?With crossing guards that direct students to their proper spots?The opportunities are endless. The point is to generate as many ideas as possible, you only need 1 to be successful. Good luck.

In my case it was simple: Developing/building racing engines was something that I really enjoyed doing. I had been "playing" with engines/performance cars, off and on most of my teen and adult life (as a hobby) and had been developing and racing my own drag car for the previous 10 years. Also, I was able to do it out of my own home and garage so I didn't have to rent any space. So, a prime criteria is to do something you really like to do and are (hopefully) good at. Another criteria would be to find some activity/product that there is a obvious market for (one of the things I did was to design a series of advanced racing roller cam lobes). Just think about that in your spare time. I would suggest, like they say so often in the movies: "Don't give up your day job" until your sure you're ready and have with a good business plan!

Instead of using just your rational abilities (logical thinking) you could try to integrate your intuition, emotion and sensations in this quest. One psychological method that can be applied (and you will need to read about and practice it until you get good enough) is to use active imagination.  Active imagination is a “meditation kind of” technique developed by the psychologist Carl Jung. Through it you can access situations, images, narratives that can help you to bring up unconscious elements and make them conscious. So, active imagination can build a bridge between the conscious ego and the creative inner self.  You can focus in your desire to solve a problem and create your own consignia (orientation) or, better yet, to have somebody guiding your way and meditation. The ideal would be to have a person who is proficient in working with active imagination and who can help you to become proficient as well.
